query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
1 Così di ponte in ponte, altro parlando 2 che la mia comedìa cantar non cura, 3 venimmo; e tenavamo ’l colmo, quando
4 restammo per veder l’altra fessura 5 di Malebolge e li altri pianti vani; 6 e vidila mirabilmente oscura.
query.result:
1 Thus from bridge to bridge, talking of other things 2 that my comedy does not care to sing, 3 we came; and we were holding the summit, when
4 we stopped to see the other cleft 5 of Malebolge and the other vain lamentations; 6 and I saw it marvelously dark.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
7 Quale ne l’arzanà de’ Viniziani 8 bolle l’inverno la tenace pece 9 a rimpalmare i legni lor non sani,
10 ché navicar non ponno—in quella vece 11 chi fa suo legno novo e chi ristoppa 12 le coste a quel che più vïaggi fece;
13 chi ribatte da proda e chi da poppa; 14 altri fa remi e altri volge sarte; 15 chi terzeruolo e artimon rintoppa—:
16 tal, non per foco ma per divin’ arte, 17 bollia là giuso una pegola spessa, 18 che ’nviscava la ripa d’ogne parte.
query.result:
7 As in the Venetian arsenal 8 in winter the sticky pitch boils 9 to caulk their unsound ships,
10 since they cannot sail—instead 11 some build a new ship and some plug up 12 the ribs of one that has made more voyages;
13 some hammer away at the prow and some at the poop; 14 others make oars and others twist ropes; 15 some patch the topsail and the mainsail—:
16 so, not by fire but by divine art, 17 a thick pitch was boiling down there, 18 which made the banks sticky on every side.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
19 I’ vedea lei, ma non vedëa in essa 20 mai che le bolle che ’l bollor levava, 21 e gonfiar tutta, e riseder compressa.
query.result: 19 I saw it, but I never saw in it 20 anything except the bubbles that the boiling raised, 21 and it swelled all up, and then sank back down compressed.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
22 Mentr’ io là giù fisamente mirava, 23 lo duca mio, dicendo «Guarda, guarda!», 24 mi trasse a sé del loco dov’ io stava.
query.result: 22 While I was gazing intently down there, 23 my leader, saying "Look, look!", 24 pulled me away from the place where I was standing.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
25 Allor mi volsi come l’uom cui tarda 26 di veder quel che li convien fuggire 27 e cui paura sùbita sgagliarda,
28 che, per veder, non indugia ’l partire: 29 e vidi dietro a noi un diavol nero 30 correndo su per lo scoglio venire.
query.result:
25 Then I turned like a man who is eager 26 to see what he must flee 27 and whom sudden fear unnerves,
28 who, in order to see, does not delay his departure: 29 and I saw behind us a black devil 30 running up the cliff towards us.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
31 Ahi quant’ elli era ne l’aspetto fero! 32 e quanto mi parea ne l’atto acerbo, 33 con l’ali aperte e sovra i piè leggero!
34 L’omero suo, ch’era aguto e superbo, 35 carcava un peccator con ambo l’anche, 36 e quei tenea de’ piè ghermito ’l nerbo.
query.result:
31 Ah, how fierce he was in appearance! 32 And how cruel he seemed to me in his actions, 33 with his wings spread and light on his feet!
34 His shoulder, which was sharp and proud, 35 was burdened with a sinner on both haunches, 36 and he held the sinew of his feet clutched in his claws.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
37 Del nostro ponte disse: «O Malebranche, 38 ecco un de li anzïan di Santa Zita! 39 Mettetel sotto, ch’i’ torno per anche
40 a quella terra, che n’è ben fornita: 41 ogn’ uom v’è barattier, fuor che Bonturo; 42 del no, per li denar, vi si fa ita».
query.result:
37 From our bridge he said: "O Malebranche, 38 here is one of the elders of Santa Zita! 39 Put him under, for I am returning again
40 to that land, which is well supplied with them: 41 every man there is a barrator, except Bonturo; 42 there, for money, 'no' is turned into 'yes'."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
43 Là giù ’l buttò, e per lo scoglio duro 44 si volse; e mai non fu mastino sciolto 45 con tanta fretta a seguitar lo furo.

Please translate literally into English.
46 Quel s’attuffò, e tornò sù convolto; 47 ma i demon che del ponte avean coperchio, 48 gridar: «Qui non ha loco il Santo Volto!
49 qui si nuota altrimenti che nel Serchio! 50 Però, se tu non vuo’ di nostri graffi, 51 non far sopra la pegola soverchio».
query.result:
46 He plunged down, and came back up twisted; 47 but the demons who had the bridge covered 48 shouted: "The Holy Face has no place here!
49 Here one swims differently than in the Serchio! 50 Therefore, if you don't want our claws, 51 don't overdo it on the pitch."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
52 Poi l’addentar con più di cento raffi, 53 disser: «Coverto convien che qui balli, 54 sì che, se puoi, nascosamente accaffi».
query.result: 52 Then they seized him with more than a hundred hooks, 53 saying: "You must dance here covered up, 54 so that, if you can, you may pilfer secretly."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
55 Non altrimenti i cuoci a’ lor vassalli 56 fanno attuffare in mezzo la caldaia 57 la carne con li uncin, perché non galli.
query.result: 55 In no other way do cooks make their scullions 56 plunge meat into the middle of the cauldron 57 with hooks, so that it does not float.

58 The good master said to me: "So that it does not appear 59 that you are here, crouch down 60 behind a rock, so that it may provide you some cover;
61 and do not fear for any offense that may be done to me, 62 for I know what is going on, 63 because I have been in such a fight before."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
64 Poscia passò di là dal co del ponte; 65 e com’ el giunse in su la ripa sesta, 66 mestier li fu d’aver sicura fronte.

Please translate literally into English.
67 Con quel furore e con quella tempesta 68 ch’escono i cani a dosso al poverello 69 che di sùbito chiede ove s’arresta,
70 usciron quei di sotto al ponticello, 71 e volser contra lui tutt’ i runcigli; 72 ma el gridò: «Nessun di voi sia fello!
73 Innanzi che l’uncin vostro mi pigli, 74 traggasi avante l’un di voi che m’oda, 75 e poi d’arruncigliarmi si consigli».
query.result:
67 With that fury and with that storm 68 with which the dogs rush upon the poor wretch 69 who suddenly stops where he is,
70 those from under the little bridge came out, 71 and turned all their grappling hooks against him; 72 but he shouted: "Let none of you be fierce!
73 Before your hooks seize me, 74 let one of you come forward to hear me, 75 and then decide whether to grapple me."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
76 Tutti gridaron: «Vada Malacoda!»; 77 per ch’un si mosse—e li altri stetter fermi— 78 e venne a lui dicendo: «Che li approda?».

Please translate literally into English.
79 «Credi tu, Malacoda, qui vedermi 80 esser venuto», disse ’l mio maestro, 81 «sicuro già da tutti vostri schermi,
82 sanza voler divino e fato destro? 83 Lascian’ andar, ché nel cielo è voluto 84 ch’i’ mostri altrui questo cammin silvestro».
query.result:
79 "Do you think, Malacoda, that I have come here 80 to see you," said my master, 81 "already safe from all your defenses,
82 without divine will and favorable fate? 83 Let me go, for it is willed in heaven 84 that I should show others this wild path."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
85 Allor li fu l’orgoglio sì caduto, 86 ch’e’ si lasciò cascar l’uncino a’ piedi, 87 e disse a li altri: «Omai non sia feruto».
query.result: 85 Then his pride fell so low 86 that he let the hook fall at his feet, 87 and said to the others: "Let him not be harmed anymore."

query.result: 88 And my leader to me: "O you who sit 89 among the fragments of the bridge, crouching low, 90 now come back to me confidently."

query.result: 103 But that demon who was speaking 104 with my leader, turned around very quickly 105 and said: "Stop, stop, Scarmiglione!"

query.result: 127 "Oh me, master, what is that I see?" 128 I said, "ah, let us go there alone, without an escort, 129 if you know the way; for I do not ask for one for myself.

query.result: 130 If you are as wise as you usually are, 131 don't you see that they are gnashing their teeth 132 and threatening us with pain with their eyebrows?"
